definitions.definition: Me , as direct or indirect object the speaker as the object of a verb or preposition, when the speaker is also the subject .
examples: (I) don’t think much of your new car, myself .

definitions.definition: Personally , for my part; used in apposition to I , sometimes for simple emphasis and sometimes with implicit exclusion of any others performing the activity described.
examples: I myself have witnessed the event.

definitions.definition: In my normal state of body or mind.
Me , as the object of a verb or preposition without a reflexive trigger. Sometimes used for intensifying the pronoun of oneself.
examples: Give the ball to John or myself .

definitions.definition: I (as the subject of a verb).
examples: My wife and myself want to go on vacation.

main_definition: ( reflexive pronoun ) Me , as direct or indirect object the speaker as the object of a verb or preposition, when the speaker is also the subject . [from 9th c.]
secondary_definitions: Personally , for my part; used in apposition to I , sometimes for simple emphasis and sometimes with implicit exclusion of any others performing the activity described. [from 10th c.]
In my normal state of body or mind.
( proscribed ) Me , as the object of a verb or preposition without a reflexive trigger. Sometimes used for intensifying the pronoun of oneself. [from 10th c.]
( archaic , now proscribed ) I (as the subject of a verb). [from 14th c.]
( India , Pakistan , nonstandard ) my name is ...
